creator: ebisse@hotmail.com

text:
Hi Emmanuel.

The issue here is that you are building the HTML documentation (basically, the 
http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/batik/ site) and this requires Apache Forrest to 
be installed.  Either install Forrest, or choose a build target that doesn't 
build the documentation.  (Building the javadocs is fine, if you just use the 
"javadoc" build target.)
creator: cam@apache.org

text:
Hi,

I installed Appache Forrest and added this paths to my envorinment:
FORREST_HOME = "C:\Bissse\apache-forrest-0.8\bin"
PATH = ....;C:\Bissse\apache-forrest-0.8\bin;

Still the build failed.

Thanks

Emmanuel.

ebisse@hotmail.com
text:
Hi,

Investigating the build script, we don't were the "site" is created before 
being use.

Our reading of the script is that site might be necessary if you do a check-in 
on SVN. 

For people who just want to build the library migh be site is not necessary. 
So please  build on a clean machine.  

Thanks

Emmanuel.

:\Bissse\Development\workspace\batik-1.6\build.xml:2040: 
C:\Bissse\Development\workspace\batik-1.6\batik-1.7pre\forrest\site not found.

(In reply to comment #2)
> Hi,
> 
> I installed Appache Forrest and added this paths to my envorinment:
> FORREST_HOME = "C:\Bissse\apache-forrest-0.8\bin"

Try leaving off the "\bin" from your FORREST_HOME.  The build script will 
append it when building the path to the forrest executable.
creator: cam@apache.org
ebisse@hotmail.com
text:
Hi,

I think there is an issue with the two folders “Forres”t and “site”. (see the 
build log.) As you can see, during the build phase, there is a folder named 
\batik-1.7\batik-1.7\forrest\ created. But, there is no \batik-1.7\batik-1.7
\forrest\site folder. However there is an expectation of the existence of such 
folder. Where and when is this folder created?.  Please try to build on a 
standalone clean machine. Maybe you will reproduce the issue.
Thanks

Emmanuel.

across the same problem as you, where the forrest call did not seem to generate 
the documentation.  This does work for me with the latest code from SVN, 
though, so could you please try that and get back to me on whether that works 
for you.  You can grab a snapshot of the source from here:

  http://people.apache.org/builds/xml-batik/

text:
Hi Emannuel.

OK, I downloaded that same source snapshot and came across that problem.  I 
think the issue is that the source distribution does not include the 
forrest.properties file from SVN, which is required to make the forrest 
documentation build properly.  I've fixed this in SVN now, so if you wait until 
tonight's source snapshot is built and then grab that, it should work.

Let me know if this works for you, so I can close the bug.
creator: cam@apache.org
cam@apache.org

text:
(In reply to comment #11)
> the build was successfull but I got this error:
> ===============================================
>    [exec] Execute failed: java.io.IOException: Cannot run program "svn": 
> CreateProcess error=2, The system cannot find the file specified
> determine-svn-revision-transform:
> determine-svn-revision-from-file:
>  [loadfile] C:\Bissse\Development\workspace\batik-1.7pre\svn-revision doesn't 
> exist
> determine-svn-revision-set:
> determine-svn-revision:
> =============================================
> do you have any explanation?

This seems to be caused by the build process which tries to determine revision directly from the repository. One can safely ignore this, though you may avoid this error by installing subversion [1] (in your case, apparently Windows [2]). :-)

I take the opportunity to suggest directing support-related questions to the mailing list [3] first - aside from having a broader audience, this may help avoiding creation of bugs which seem to be related to software dependencies. ;-)  On the other hand, I wasn't able to easily find a document with build instructions (where all software dependencies would be listed, for example)...

I have experimenting with the SVN code [4] lately and have never experienced this behavior so IMO this can be marked fixed. Emmanuel: can you confirm this?

Environment:
OS - Windows XP SP3
Java - JDK 1.6.0_06
Batik - SVN

[1] http://subversion.tigris.org/
[2] http://subversion.tigris.org/getting.html#windows
[3] http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/batik/mailing-lists.html#batik-users
[4] http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/batik/download.cgi#Subversion+repository

creator: helder.magalhaes@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to comment #12)
> Emmanuel: can you confirm this?

Not experienced using the trunk version and no confirmation was received within a reasonable timeline so marking this one as fixed until proved otherwise. ;-)
